/Users/trevorw/projects/tke-code/lib/plugins.tcl

00001 # Name:    plugins.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/11/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace to support the plugin framework.
00005 #
00006 # List of available plugin actions:
00007 #  menu         - Adds a menu to the main menubar
00008 #  tab_popup    - Adds items to the tab popup menu
00009 #  root_popup   - Adds items to a root directory sidebar popup menu
00010 #  dir_popup    - Adds items to a non-root directory sidebar popup menu
00011 #  file_popup   - Adds items to a file sidebar popup menu
00012 #  text_binding - Adds one or more bindings to a created text field.
00013 #  on_start     - Runs when the editor is started or when the plugin is installed
00014 #  on_open      - Runs when a tab is opened
00015 #  on_focusin   - Runs when a tab receives focus
00016 #  on_close     - Runs when a tab is closed
00017 #  on_update    - Runs when a tab is updated
00018 #  on_quit      - Runs when the editor is exited
00019 #  on_reload    - Takes action when the plugin is reloaded
00020 #  on_save      - Runs prior to a file being saved
00021 #  on_uninstall - Runs when the plugin is uninstalled by the user.  Allows UI cleanup, etc.
00022 #  syntax       - Adds the given syntax file to the list of available syntaxes
00023 
00024 namespace eval plugins {
00025 
00026   variable registry_size 0
00027   variable plugin_mb     ""
00028   variable tab_popup     ""
00029   variable root_popup    ""
00030   variable dir_popup     ""
00031   variable file_popup    ""
00032 
00033   array set registry     {}
00034   array set plugins      {}
00035   array set prev_sourced {}
00036   array set bound_tags   {}
00037   array set menu_vars    {}
00038 
00039   ######################################################################
00040   # Handles any changes to plugin menu variables.
00041   proc handle_menu_variable {index name1 name2 op} {
00042 
00043     variable registry
00044     variable menu_vars
00045 
00046     $registry($index,interp) eval set $name2 $menu_vars($name2)
00047 
00048   }
00049 
00050   ######################################################################
00051   # Procedure that is called be each plugin that registers all of the
00052   # actions that the plugin can perform.
00053   proc register {name actions} {
00054 
00055     variable registry
00056     variable registry_size
00057 
00058     set i 0
00059     while {($i < $registry_size) && ($registry($i,name) ne $name)} {
00060       incr i
00061     }
00062 
00063     if {$i < $registry_size} {
00064       set j 0
00065       foreach action $actions {
00066         set registry($i,action,[lindex $action 0],$j) [lrange $action 1 end]
00067         incr j
00068       }
00069     }
00070 
00071   }
00072 
00073   ######################################################################
00074   # Loads the header information from all available plugins.
00075   proc load {{read_config_file 1}} {
00076 
00077     variable registry
00078     variable registry_size
00079 
00080     set registry_size 0
00081 
00082     foreach plugin [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_dir plugins] -types d *] {
00083 
00084       # Read the header information
00085       if {![catch { tkedat::read [file join $plugin header.tkedat] 0 } rc]} {
00086 
00087         array set header $rc
00088 
00089         # Store this information if the name is specified and it should be included
00090         if {[info exists header(name)] && ($header(name) ne "") && [info exists header(include)] && ($header(include) eq "yes")} {
00091           set registry($registry_size,selected)    0
00092           set registry($registry_size,status)      ""
00093           set registry($registry_size,interp)      ""
00094           set registry($registry_size,tgntd)       0
00095           set registry($registry_size,file)        [file join $plugin main.tcl]
00096           set registry($registry_size,name)        $header(name)
00097           set registry($registry_size,author)      [expr {[info exists header(author)]         ? $header(author)         : ""}]
00098           set registry($registry_size,email)       [expr {[info exists header(email)]          ? $header(email)          : ""}]
00099           set registry($registry_size,version)     [expr {[info exists header(version)]        ? $header(version)        : ""}]
00100           set registry($registry_size,description) [expr {[info exists header(description)]    ? $header(description)    : ""}]
00101           set registry($registry_size,treqd)       [expr {[info exists header(trust_required)] ? ([string compare -nocase $header(trust_required) "yes"] == 0) : 0}]
00102           incr registry_size
00103         }
00104 
00105       }
00106 
00107     }
00108 
00109     # Read in the contents of the plugin configuration file
00110     if {$read_config_file} {
00111       read_config
00112     }
00113 
00114   }
00115 
00116   ######################################################################
00117   # Perfoms a reload of the available plugins.
00118   proc reload {} {
00119 
00120     variable registry
00121     variable registry_size
00122     variable prev_sourced
00123 
00124     # Delete all plugin menu items
00125     delete_all_menus
00126 
00127     # Delete all plugin text bindings
00128     delete_all_text_bindings
00129 
00130     # Delete all plugin syntax registrations
00131     delete_all_syntax
00132 
00133     catch { array unset prev_sourced }
00134     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00135       if {$registry($i,selected) && ($registry($i,interp) ne "")} {
00136         foreach action [array names registry $i,action,on_reload,*] {
00137           set prev_sourced($registry($i,name)) $registry($action)
00138         }
00139         handle_resourcing $i
00140         interpreter::destroy $registry($i,name)
00141         set registry($i,interp) ""
00142       }
00143     }
00144 
00145     # Clear the plugin information
00146     array unset registry
00147     set registry_size 0
00148 
00149     # Load plugin header information
00150     load
00151 
00152     # Add all of the plugins
00153     add_all_menus
00154 
00155     # Add all of the text bindings
00156     add_all_text_bindings
00157 
00158     # Add all of the syntaxes
00159     add_all_syntax
00160 
00161     # Tell the user that the plugins have been successfully reloaded
00162     gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugins successfully reloaded"]
00163 
00164   }
00165 
00166   ######################################################################
00167   # Writes the current plugin configuration file to the tke home directory.
00168   proc write_config {} {
00169 
00170     variable registry
00171     variable registry_size
00172     variable plugins
00173 
00174     # Create the array to store in the plugins.tkedat file
00175     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00176       set plugins($registry($i,name)) [list selected $registry($i,selected) trust_granted $registry($i,tgntd)]
00177     }
00178 
00179     # Store the data
00180     catch { tkedat::write [file join $::tke_home plugins.tkedat] [array get plugins] }
00181 
00182   }
00183 
00184   ######################################################################
00185   # Reads the user's plugin configuration file.
00186   proc read_config {} {
00187 
00188     variable registry
00189     variable registry_size
00190     variable plugins
00191     variable prev_sourced
00192 
00193     set bad_sources [list]
00194 
00195     # Read the plugins file
00196     if {![catch { tkedat::read [file join $::tke_home plugins.tkedat] } rc]} {
00197 
00198       array set plugins $rc
00199 
00200       for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00201         if {[info exists plugins($registry($i,name))]} {
00202           array set data $plugins($registry($i,name))
00203           if {$data(selected) || [info exists prev_sourced($registry($i,name))]} {
00204             set registry($i,selected) 1
00205             set registry($i,tgntd)    $data(trust_granted)
00206             set interpreter [interpreter::create $registry($i,name) $data(trust_granted)]
00207             if {[catch "interp eval $interpreter source $registry($i,file)" status]} {
00208               handle_status_error $i $status
00209               lappend bad_sources $i
00210               interpreter::destroy $registry($i,name)
00211             } else {
00212               set registry($i,interp) $interpreter
00213               handle_reloading $i
00214               # add_all_text_bindings
00215             }
00216           }
00217         }
00218 
00219       }
00220 
00221     }
00222 
00223     # If there was an error in sourcing any of the selected plugins, report the error to the user
00224     if {[llength $bad_sources] > 0} {
00225       set names [list]
00226       foreach bad_source $bad_sources {
00227         set registry($bad_source,selected) 0
00228         lappend names $registry($bad_source,name)
00229       }
00230       tk_messageBox -default ok -type ok -icon warning -parent . -title [msgcat::mc "Plugin Errors"] \
00231         -message [msgcat::mc "Syntax errors found in selected plugins"] -detail [join $names \n]
00232     }
00233 
00234   }
00235 
00236   ######################################################################
00237   # Handles an error when sourcing a plugin file.
00238   proc handle_status_error {index status} {
00239 
00240     variable registry
00241 
00242     # Save the status
00243     set registry($index,status) $status
00244 
00245     # If we are doing development, send the full error info to standard output
00246     if {[::tke_development]} {
00247       puts $::errorInfo
00248     }
00249 
00250     # Set the current information message
00251     gui::set_info_message "ERROR: [lindex [split $status \n] 0]"
00252 
00253   }
00254 
00255   ######################################################################
00256   # Called when a plugin is sourced.  Checks to see if the plugin wants
00257   # to be called to save data when it is resourced (data will otherwise
00258   # be lost once the plugin has been resourced.
00259   proc handle_resourcing {index} {
00260 
00261     variable registry
00262     variable prev_sourced
00263 
00264     set name $registry($index,name)
00265 
00266     if {$registry($index,selected) && [info exists prev_sourced($name)]} {
00267       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval [lindex $prev_sourced($name) 0] $index" status]} {
00268         handle_status_error $index $status
00269       }
00270     }
00271 
00272   }
00273 
00274   ######################################################################
00275   # Called when a plugin is sourced.  If the plugin retrieves saved information,
00276   # allows the plugin to do it.
00277   proc handle_reloading {index} {
00278 
00279     variable registry
00280     variable prev_sourced
00281 
00282     set name $registry($index,name)
00283 
00284     if {$registry($index,selected) && [info exists prev_sourced($name)]} {
00285       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval [lindex $prev_sourced($name) 1] $index" status]} {
00286         handle_status_error $index $status
00287       }
00288     }
00289 
00290   }
00291 
00292   ######################################################################
00293   # Allows a plugin to save temporary data to non-corruptible memory.
00294   # This memory will be cleared whenever the plugin retrieves the data.
00295   proc save_data {index name value} {
00296 
00297     variable temp_user_data
00298 
00299     set temp_user_data($index,$name) $value
00300 
00301   }
00302 
00303   ######################################################################
00304   # If a previous call to save_data form the same index/name combination
00305   # was called, returns the value stored for that variable.  Removes
00306   # temporary memory prior to returning.
00307   proc restore_data {index name} {
00308 
00309     variable temp_user_data
00310 
00311     if {[info exists temp_user_data($index,$name)]} {
00312       set value $temp_user_data($index,$name)
00313       unset temp_user_data($index,$name)
00314     } else {
00315       set value ""
00316     }
00317 
00318     return $value
00319 
00320   }

00322   ######################################################################
00323   # Installs available plugins.
00324   proc install {} {
00325 
00326     variable registry
00327     variable registry_size
00328 
00329     # Add registries to launcher
00330     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00331       if {!$registry($i,selected)} {
00332         set name $registry($i,name)
00333         launcher::register_temp "`PLUGIN:$name" "plugins::install_item $i" $name 0 "plugins::show_detail $i"
00334       }
00335     }
00336 
00337     # Display the launcher in PLUGIN: mode
00338     launcher::launch "`PLUGIN:" 1
00339 
00340   }
00341 
00342   ######################################################################
00343   # Installs the plugin in the registry specified by name.
00344   proc install_item {index} {
00345 
00346     variable registry
00347 
00348     # Delete all plugin menu items
00349     delete_all_menus
00350 
00351     # Delete all plugin text bindings
00352     delete_all_text_bindings
00353 
00354     # Delete all syntax
00355     delete_all_syntax
00356 
00357     # Source the file if it hasn't been previously sourced
00358     if {$registry($index,interp) eq ""} {
00359       if {$registry($index,treqd) && !$registry($index,tgntd)} {
00360         set answer [tk_dialog .installwin "Plugin Trust Requested" \
00361           "The $registry($index,name) plugin requires permission to view/modify your system.  Grant permission?" \
00362           "" "Grant" "Reject" "Grant" "Always grant from developer"]
00363         switch $answer {
00364           "Grant"  { set registry($index,tgntd) 1 }
00365           "Reject" { set registry($index,tgntd) 0 }
00366           default  {
00367             set registry($index,tgntd) 1
00368           }
00369         }
00370       }
00371       set interpreter [interpreter::create $registry($index,name) $registry($index,tgntd)]
00372       if {[catch "uplevel #0 [list interp eval $interpreter source $registry($index,file)]" status]} {
00373         handle_status_error $index $status
00374         set registry($index,selected) 0
00375         interpreter::destroy $registry($index,name)
00376       } else {
00377         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugin %s installed" $registry($index,name)]
00378         set registry($index,selected) 1
00379         set registry($index,interp)   $interpreter
00380         handle_reloading $index
00381         run_on_start_after_install $index
00382       }
00383 
00384     # Otherwise, just mark the plugin as being selected
00385     } else {
00386       gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugin %s installed" $registry($index,name)]
00387       set registry($index,selected) 1
00388       run_on_start_after_install $index
00389     }
00390 
00391     # Add all of the plugins
00392     add_all_menus
00393 
00394     # Add all of the text bindings
00395     add_all_text_bindings
00396 
00397     # Add all syntaxes
00398     add_all_syntax
00399 
00400   }
00401 
00402   ######################################################################
00403   # This procedure is called in the install_item procedure and causes any
00404   # on_start actions associated with the plugin to be called when the plugin
00405   # is installed.
00406   proc run_on_start_after_install {index} {
00407 
00408     variable registry
00409 
00410     # If the given event contains an "on_uninstall" action, run it.
00411     foreach {name action} [array get registry $index,action,on_start,*] {
00412       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval {*}$action" status]} {
00413         handle_status_error $index $status
00414       }
00415     }
00416 
00417   }
00418 
00419   ######################################################################
00420   # Uninstalls previously installed plugins.
00421   proc uninstall {} {
00422 
00423     variable registry
00424     variable registry_size
00425 
00426     for {set i 0} {$i < $registry_size} {incr i} {
00427       if {$registry($i,selected)} {
00428         set name $registry($i,name)
00429         launcher::register_temp "`PLUGIN:$name" "plugins::uninstall_item $i" $name
00430       }
00431     }
00432 
00433     # Display the launcher in PLUGIN: mode
00434     launcher::launch "`PLUGIN:"
00435 
00436   }
00437 
00438   ######################################################################
00439   # Uninstalls the specified plugin.
00440   proc uninstall_item {index} {
00441 
00442     variable registry
00443 
00444     # Call "on_uninstall" command, if it exists
00445     handle_on_uninstall $index
00446 
00447     # Delete all plugin menu items
00448     delete_all_menus
00449 
00450     # Delete all text bindings
00451     delete_all_text_bindings
00452 
00453     # Delete all syntax
00454     delete_all_syntax
00455 
00456     # Destroy the interpreter
00457     interpreter::destroy $registry($index,name)
00458 
00459     # Unselect the plugin
00460     set registry($index,selected) 0
00461     set registry($index,interp)   ""
00462 
00463     # Add all of the plugins
00464     add_all_menus
00465 
00466     # Add all of the text bindings
00467     add_all_text_bindings
00468 
00469     # Add all of the syntaxes
00470     add_all_syntax
00471 
00472     # Display the uninstall message
00473     gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "Plugin %s uninstalled" $registry($index,name)]
00474 
00475   }

00477   ######################################################################
00478   # Displays plugin information into the given text widget.
00479   proc show_detail {index txt} {
00480 
00481     variable registry
00482 
00483     $txt tag configure bold -underline 1
00484 
00485     $txt insert end "Version:\n\n" bold
00486     $txt insert end "$registry($index,version)\n\n\n"
00487     $txt insert end "Description:\n\n" bold
00488     $txt insert end $registry($index,description)
00489 
00490   }

00492   ######################################################################
00493   # Creates a new plugin
00494   proc create_new_plugin {} {
00495 
00496     set name ""
00497 
00498     if {[gui::user_response_get [msgcat::mc "Enter plugin name"] name]} {
00499 
00500       if {![regexp {^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$} $name]} {
00501         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Plugin name is not valid (only alphanumeric and underscores are allowed)"]
00502         return
00503       }
00504 
00505       set dirname [file join $::tke_dir plugins $name]
00506 
00507       if {[file exists $dirname]} {
00508         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Plugin name already exists"]
00509         return
00510       }
00511 
00512       # Create the plugin directory
00513       if {[catch { file mkdir $dirname }]} {
00514         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Unable to create plugin directory"]
00515         return
00516       }
00517 
00518       # Create the filenames
00519       set header [file join $dirname header.tkedat]
00520       set main   [file join $dirname main.tcl]
00521 
00522       # Create the main file
00523       if {[catch { open $main w } rc]} {
00524         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Unable to write plugin files"]
00525         return
00526       }
00527 
00528       # Create the main file
00529       puts $rc "# Plugin namespace"
00530       puts $rc "namespace eval $name {"
00531       puts $rc ""
00532       puts $rc "  # INSERT CODE HERE"
00533       puts $rc ""
00534       puts $rc "}"
00535       puts $rc ""
00536       puts $rc "# Register all plugin actions"
00537       puts $rc "api::register $name {"
00538       puts $rc ""
00539       puts $rc "}"
00540       close $rc
00541 
00542       # Add the new file to the editor
00543       gui::add_file end $main -savecommand plugins::reload
00544 
00545       # Create the header file
00546       if {[catch { open $header w } rc]} {
00547         gui::set_info_message [msgcat::mc "ERROR:  Unable to write plugin files"]
00548         return
00549       }
00550 
00551       # Create the header file
00552       puts $rc "name           {$name}"
00553       puts $rc "author         {}"
00554       puts $rc "email          {}"
00555       puts $rc "version        {1.0}"
00556       puts $rc "include        {yes}"
00557       puts $rc "trust_required {no}"
00558       puts $rc "description    {}"
00559       close $rc
00560 
00561       # Add the file to the editor
00562       gui::add_file end $header -savecommand plugins::reload
00563 
00564     }
00565 
00566   }
00567 
00568   ######################################################################
00569   # Finds all of the registry entries that match the given action.
00570   proc find_registry_entries {type} {
00571 
00572     variable registry
00573 
00574     set plugin_list [list]
00575     foreach action [lsort -dictionary [array names registry *,action,$type,*]] {
00576       lassign [split $action ,] index
00577       if {$registry($index,selected)} {
00578         lappend plugin_list [concat $index $registry($action)]
00579       }
00580     }
00581 
00582     return $plugin_list
00583 
00584   }
00585 
00586   ######################################################################
00587   # Adds the menus to the given plugin menu.  This is called after the
00588   # plugin menu is initially created.
00589   proc menu_add {mnu action} {
00590 
00591     # Get the list of menu entries
00592     if {[llength [set entries [find_registry_entries $action]]] > 0} {
00593       $mnu add separator
00594     }
00595 
00596     # Add each of the entries
00597     foreach entry $entries {
00598       lassign $entry index type hier do state
00599       menu_add_item $index $mnu $action [split $hier /] $type $do $state
00600     }
00601 
00602   }
00603 
00604   ######################################################################
00605   # Adds menu item, creating all needed cascading menus.
00606   proc menu_add_item {index mnu action hier type do state} {
00607 
00608     variable registry
00609     variable menu_vars
00610 
00611     # If the type is a separator, we need to run the while loop one more time
00612     set force [expr {[lindex $type 0] eq "separator"}]
00613 
00614     # Add cascading menus
00615     while {([set hier_len [llength [set hier [lassign $hier level]]]] > 0) || $force} {
00616       set sub_mnu [string tolower [string map {{ } _} $level]]
00617       if {![winfo exists $mnu.$sub_mnu]} {
00618         set new_mnu [menu $mnu.$sub_mnu -tearoff 0 -postcommand "plugins::menu_state $mnu.$sub_mnu $action"]
00619         $registry($index,interp) alias $new_mnu interpreter::widget_win $registry($index,name) $new_mnu
00620         $mnu add cascade -label $level -menu $mnu.$sub_mnu
00621       }
00622       set mnu $mnu.$sub_mnu
00623       if {$hier_len == 0} {
00624         set force 0
00625       }
00626     }
00627 
00628     # Handle the state
00629     if {$state ne ""} {
00630       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $state" status]} {
00631         handle_status_error $index $status
00632         set state "disabled"
00633       } elseif {$status} {
00634         set state "normal"
00635       } else {
00636         set state "disabled"
00637       }
00638     }
00639 
00640     # Add menu item
00641     switch [lindex $type 0] {
00642       command {
00643         $mnu add command -label $level -command [list $registry($index,interp) eval {*}$do] -state $state
00644       }
00645       checkbutton {
00646         set menu_vars([lindex $type 1]) [$registry($index,interp) eval set [lindex $type 1]]
00647         $mnu add checkbutton -label $level -variable plugins::menu_vars([lindex $type 1]) \
00648           -command [list $registry($index,interp) eval {*}$do] -state $state
00649         trace variable plugins::menu_vars([lindex $type 1]) w "plugins::handle_menu_variable $index"
00650       }
00651       radiobutton {
00652         set menu_vars([lindex $type 1]) [$registry($index,interp) eval set [lindex $type 1]]
00653         $mnu add radiobutton -label $level -variable plugins::menu_vars([lindex $type 1]) \
00654           -value [lindex $type 2] -command [list $registry($index,interp) eval {*}$do] -state $state
00655         trace variable plugins::menu_vars([lindex $type 1]) w "plugins::handle_menu_variable $index"
00656       }
00657       cascade {
00658         set new_mnu_name "$mnu.[string tolower [string map {{ } _} $level]]"
00659         set new_mnu [menu $new_mnu_name -tearoff 0 -postcommand "plugins::post_cascade_menu $index $do $new_mnu_name"]
00660         $registry($index,interp) alias $new_mnu interpreter::widget_win $registry($index,name) $new_mnu
00661         $mnu add cascade -label $level -menu $new_mnu
00662       }
00663       separator {
00664         $mnu add separator
00665       }
00666     }
00667 
00668   }
00669 
00670   ######################################################################
00671   # Handles a cascade menu post command.
00672   proc post_cascade_menu {index do mnu} {
00673 
00674     variable registry
00675 
00676     # Recursively delete all of the items in the given menu
00677     menu_delete_cascade $mnu
00678 
00679     # Call the plugins do command to populate the menu
00680     if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $do $mnu" status]} {
00681       handle_status_error $index $status
00682     }
00683 
00684   }
00685 
00686   ######################################################################
00687   # Recursively deletes all submenus of the given menu.
00688   proc menu_delete_cascade {mnu} {
00689 
00690     # If the menu is empty, stop now
00691     if {[$mnu index end] ne "none"} {
00692 
00693       # Recursively remove the children menus
00694       for {set i 0} {$i <= [$mnu index end]} {incr i} {
00695         if {[$mnu type $i] eq "cascade"} {
00696           menu_delete_cascade [set child_menu [$mnu entrycget $i -menu]]
00697           destroy $child_menu
00698         }
00699       }
00700 
00701       # Delete all of the menu items
00702       $mnu delete 0 end
00703 
00704     }
00705 
00706   }
00707 
00708   ######################################################################
00709   # Deletes all of the menus in the plugins menu.
00710   proc menu_delete {mnu action} {
00711 
00712     variable menus
00713 
00714     # Get the list of menu entries
00715     if {[llength [set entries [find_registry_entries $action]]] > 0} {
00716 
00717       # Delete all of the plugin items
00718       foreach entry $entries {
00719         lassign $entry index type hier
00720         set hier [split [string tolower [string map {{ } _} $hier]] /]
00721         if {$type ne "cascade"} {
00722           set hier [lrange $hier 0 end-1]
00723         }
00724         if {[menu_delete_item $mnu $hier]} {
00725           $mnu delete last
00726         }
00727       }
00728 
00729       # Delete the last separator
00730       $mnu delete last
00731 
00732     }
00733 
00734   }
00735 
00736   ######################################################################
00737   # Deletes one upper level
00738   proc menu_delete_item {mnu hier} {
00739 
00740     while {[llength $hier] > 0} {
00741       if {![winfo exists $mnu.[join $hier .]]} {
00742         return 0
00743       }
00744       catch { destroy $mnu.[join $hier .] }
00745       set hier [lrange $hier 0 end-1]
00746     }
00747 
00748     return 1
00749 
00750   }
00751 
00752   ######################################################################
00753   # Updates the plugin menu state of the given menu.
00754   proc menu_state {mnu action} {
00755 
00756     variable registry
00757     variable menus
00758 
00759     foreach entry [find_registry_entries $action] {
00760       lassign $entry index type hier do state
00761       set entry_mnu $menus($action)
00762       if {[llength [set hier_list [split $hier /]]] > 1} {
00763         append entry_mnu ".[string tolower [string map {{ } _} [join [lrange $hier_list 0 end-1] .]]]"
00764       }
00765       if {$mnu eq $entry_mnu} {
00766         if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $state" status]} {
00767           handle_status_error $index $status
00768         } elseif {$status} {
00769           $mnu entryconfigure [lindex $hier_list end] -state normal
00770         } else {
00771           $mnu entryconfigure [lindex $hier_list end] -state disabled
00772         }
00773       }
00774     }
00775 
00776   }
00777 
00778   ######################################################################
00779   # Adds all of the plugins to the list of available menus.
00780   proc add_all_menus {} {
00781 
00782     variable menus
00783 
00784     foreach {action mnu} [array get menus] {
00785       menu_add $mnu $action
00786     }
00787 
00788   }

00790   ######################################################################
00791   # Adds all of the text bindings to all open text widgets.
00792   proc add_all_text_bindings {} {
00793 
00794     foreach txt [gui::get_all_texts] {
00795       handle_text_bindings $txt
00796     }
00797 
00798   }

00800   ######################################################################
00801   # Adds all of the syntax files.
00802   proc add_all_syntax {} {
00803 
00804     variable registry
00805 
00806     foreach entry [find_registry_entries "syntax"] {
00807       lassign $entry index sfile
00808       set sfile [file join $::tke_dir plugins $registry($index,name) $sfile]
00809       syntax::add_syntax $sfile $registry($index,interp)
00810     }
00811 
00812   }
00813 
00814   ######################################################################
00815   # Deletes all plugins from their respective menus.
00816   proc delete_all_menus {} {
00817 
00818     variable menus
00819 
00820     foreach {action mnu} [array get menus] {
00821       menu_delete $mnu $action
00822     }
00823 
00824   }
00825 
00826   ######################################################################
00827   # Deletes all text bindings that were previously created.
00828   proc delete_all_text_bindings {} {
00829 
00830     variable bound_tags
00831 
00832     foreach {bt txts} [array get bound_tags] {
00833       foreach txt $txts {
00834         if {[set index [lsearch -exact [set btags [bindtags $txt]] $bt]] != -1} {
00835           bindtags $txt [lreplace $btags $index $index]
00836         }
00837         if {[set index [lsearch -exact [set btags [bindtags $txt.t]] $bt]] != -1} {
00838           bindtags $txt.t [lreplace $btags $index $index]
00839         }
00840       }
00841     }
00842 
00843     # Delete all of the bound tags
00844     array unset bound_tags
00845 
00846   }
00847 
00848   ######################################################################
00849   # Removes the given syntax files.
00850   proc delete_all_syntax {} {
00851 
00852     foreach entry [find_registry_entries "syntax"] {
00853       lassign $entry index sfile
00854       syntax::delete_syntax $sfile
00855     }
00856 
00857   }

00861   proc handle_plugin_menu {mnu} {
00862 
00863     variable menus
00864 
00865     # Add the menu to the list of menus to update
00866     set menus(menu) $mnu
00867 
00868     # Add the menu items
00869     menu_add $mnu menu
00870 
00871   }

00920   ######################################################################
00921   # Creates a bindtag on behalf of the user for the given text widget
00922   # and calls the associated procedure to have the bindings added.
00923   proc handle_text_bindings {txt} {
00924 
00925     variable registry
00926     variable bound_tags
00927 
00928     set ctags       [bindtags $txt]
00929     set cpre_index  [expr [lsearch -exact $ctags $txt] + 1]
00930     set cpost_index [lsearch -exact $ctags .]
00931 
00932     set ttags       [bindtags $txt.t]
00933     set tpre_index  [expr [lsearch -exact $ttags $txt.t] + 1]
00934     set tpost_index [lsearch -exact $ttags .]
00935 
00936     foreach entry [find_registry_entries "text_binding"] {
00937       lassign $entry index type name cmd
00938       set bt "plugin__$registry($index,name)__$name"
00939       bindtags $txt   [linsert $ctags [expr {($type eq "pretext") ? $cpre_index : $cpost_index}] $bt]
00940       # bindtags $txt.t [linsert $ttags [expr {($type eq "pretext") ? $tpre_index : $tpost_index}] $bt]
00941       $registry($index,interp) alias $txt $txt
00942       # $registry($index,interp) alias $txt.t $txt.t
00943       interpreter::add_ctext $registry($index,name) $txt
00944       if {![info exists bound_tags($bt)]} {
00945         if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval $cmd $bt" status]} {
00946           handle_status_error $index $status
00947         }
00948         set bound_tags($bt) $txt
00949       } else {
00950         lappend bound_tags($bt) $txt
00951       }
00952     }
00953 
00954   }
00955 
00956   ######################################################################
00957   # Generically handles the given event.
00958   proc handle_event {event args} {
00959 
00960     variable registry
00961 
00962     foreach entry [find_registry_entries $event] {
00963       if {[catch "$registry([lindex $entry 0],interp) eval [lindex $entry 1] $args" status]} {
00964         handle_status_error [lindex $entry 0] $status
00965       }
00966     }
00967 
00968   }
00969 
00970   ######################################################################
00971   # Called whenever the application is started.
00972   proc handle_on_start {} {
00973 
00974     # Handle an application start
00975     handle_event "on_start"
00976 
00977   }

01019   ######################################################################
01020   # Called when the application is exiting.
01021   proc handle_on_quit {} {
01022 
01023     # Handle the on_quit event
01024     handle_event "on_quit"
01025 
01026     # Finally, write the plugin information file
01027     write_config
01028 
01029   }
01030 
01031   ######################################################################
01032   # Called when a plugin is uninstalled.
01033   proc handle_on_uninstall {index} {
01034 
01035     variable registry
01036 
01037     # If the given event contains an "on_uninstall" action, run it.
01038     foreach {name action} [array get registry $index,action,on_uninstall,*] {
01039       if {[catch "$registry($index,interp) eval {*}$action" status]} {
01040         handle_status_error $index $status
01041       }
01042     }
01043 
01044   }
